sen.j: 神道における神（かみ）とは、信仰や畏怖の対象である。
sen.e: The "kami" found in Shinto are objects of faith that are to be feared or held in awe.
The "kami" found in Shinto are objects of faith that are to be feared or held in awe.
The "kami" found in Shinto are objects of faith that are to be feared or held in awe.

sen.j: 「八百万（やおよろず）の神」と言う場合の「八百万」は数が多いことの例えである。
sen.e: The number "8 million" appearing in the expression "Yaoyorozu Kami" is an example that testifies to the belief in the existence of a large number of kami.
The number "8 million" appearing in the expression "Yaoyorozu Kami" is an example that testifies to the belief in the existence of a large number of kami.
Yaoyorozu (8 million)' appearing in the expression 'Yaoyorozu no Kami' is an example of a large number.
sen.cmt: " "→' 'Yaoyorozu Kami→Yaoyorozu no KamiThe number '8 million'→'Yaoyorozu (8 million)'example 以下書き換えました。

sen.j: 分類
sen.e: Types of kami
Types of kami
Types of kami

sen.j: 神道の神々は人と同じような姿や人格を有する「人格神」であり、現世の人間に恩恵を与える「守護神」であるが、祟る性格も持っている。
sen.e: The multitude of kami in Shinto that have the same form and attributes as humans are referred to as "human-like kami", and are kami that live among humans in the world, bestowing blessings as "protector kami"; however, such kami are also capable of tormenting or harassing human beings.

The multitude of kami in Shinto that have the same form and attributes as humans are referred to as "human-like kami", and are kami that live among humans in the world, bestowing blessings as "protector kami"; however, such kami are also capable of tormenting or harassing human beings.

While Shinto's multitude of kami are 'humanized divinities' who have the same form and attributes as humans, they are also 'guardian gods' that bestow blessings on the living; however, such kami are also capable of tormenting or harassing the living.
sen.cmt: かなり書き換えました。

sen.j: （「祟り」参照）災害をもたらし、祟るからこそ、神は畏れられたのである。
sen.e: (Refer to "To curse") It is precisely because of this capacity to cause disasters and other misfortunes that kami are to be feared.
(Refer to "To curse") It is precisely because of this capacity to cause disasters and other misfortunes that kami are to be feared.
(Refer to 'To curse') It is precisely because of this capacity to cause disasters and other misfortunes that kami are to be feared.

sen.j: 神道の神は、この祟りと密接な関係にある。
sen.e: Kami in Shinto are intimately related to the ability to curse human beings.
Kami in Shinto are intimately related to the ability to curse human beings.
Kami in Shinto are intimately related to the ability to curse human beings.

sen.j: 神は大別して以下のように分類できる。
sen.e: Generally speaking, kami can be categorized as follows.
Generally speaking, kami can be categorized as follows.
Generally speaking, kami can be categorized as follows.

sen.j: 1. 自然物や自然現象を神格化した神
sen.e: Nature kami that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of a natural entity or phenomenon into a kami.
Nature kami that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of a natural entity or phenomenon into a kami.
1. Kami that have come into existence as a result of the transformation of a natural entity or phenomenon into a kami.
sen.cmt: Nature 削除ご指示通り、ここから１～６の番号を原文、訳文にふりました。

sen.j: 2. 思考・災いといった抽象的なものを神格化した観念神
sen.e: Ideational kami that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of an abstract entity such as a concept or an evil into a kami; this type of kami.
Ideational kami that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of an abstract entity such as a concept or an evil into a kami; this type of kami.
2. Conceptual kami that have come into existence as a result of the transformation of an abstract entity such as a concept or misfortune into a kami.
sen.cmt: this type of kami 削除

sen.j: 3. 古代の指導者・有力者などを神格化したと思われる神（エウヘメリズム）
sen.e: Kami that are thought to be deified individuals that have come into existence as the result of the deification of ancient leaders, influential personages and the like (euhemerism).
Kami that are thought to be deified individuals that have come into existence as the result of the deification of ancient leaders, influential personages and the like (euhemerism).
3. Kami that are thought to be deified individuals that have come into existence as a result of the deification of ancient leaders, influential personages and the like (euhemerism).

sen.j: 4. 万物の創造主としての神（ここにおいてはthe Godである）
sen.e: The kami that are the creators of all things (referred to below as the three creator deities).
sen.cmt: I've followed the kokugaku Shinto dictionary in rendering these as "the three creator deities".
sen.e: The kami that are the creators of all things (referred to below as the three creator deities).
4. The three kami that are the creators of all things (referred to below as the three creator deities).

sen.j: 5. 万物の創造主・主宰者としての全能の天皇
sen.e: The all-powerful Emperors, who are the creators and rulers of all things.
sen.cmt: confusing as to the relationship of the creator deities and the Emperor to creation.
sen.e: The all-powerful Emperors, who are the creators and rulers of all things.
5. The all-powerful Emperors, who are the creators and rulers of all things.

sen.j: 6. 王権神授説（Theory of the divine right of kings）における「divine」としての神（天皇）
sen.e: Emperors are kami that in the sense that monarchs are considered "divine" according to the "Theory of the divine right of kings".
sen.cmt: Is this English topic title correct? (i.e., Divine Right Monarchy?) I've slightly expanded upon the somewhat sparse Japanese text.
sen.e: Emperors are kami that in the sense that monarchs are considered "divine" according to the "Theory of the divine right of kings".
6. Emperors are kami that in the sense that monarchs are considered 'divine' according to the "Theory of the divine right of kings".

tit.j: 自然物や自然現象を神格化した神
tit.e: Kami that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of natural entities or phenomena into kami.
Kami that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of natural entities or phenomena into kami.
Kami that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of natural entities or phenomena into kami.

sen.j: この中で最も古いのは1.の自然物や自然現象を神格化した神である。
sen.e: The oldest among the above-described types of kami are those that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of natural entities or phenomena into kami.
The oldest among the above-described types of kami are those that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of natural entities or phenomena into kami.
The oldest among the above-described types of kami are those that have come into existence as the result of the transformation of natural entities or phenomena into kami.

sen.j: 古代の日本人は、山、川、巨石、巨木、動物、植物などといった自然物、火、雨、風、雷などといった自然現象の中に、神々しい「何か」を感じ取った。
sen.e: In ancient Japan people felt that mountains, rivers, giant rocks, giant trees, animals, plants and other natural things, as well as natural phenomena such as fire, rain, wind, thunder and the like inspired a sense of awe, as in "that's something else".
sen.cmt: at a bit of a loss as to what to do with "神々しい「何か」を感じ取った"
sen.e: In ancient Japan people felt that mountains, rivers, giant rocks, giant trees, animals, plants and other natural things, as well as natural phenomena such as fire, rain, wind, thunder and the like inspired a sense of awe, as in "that's something else".

In ancient Japan, people felt that there was something awe-inspiring about the mountains, rivers, giant rocks, giant trees, animals, plants, and other such elements of nature, as well as natural phenomena such as fire, rain, wind, thunder, and the like.

sen.j: この感覚は今日でも神道の根本として残るものであり、小泉八雲はこれを「神道の感覚」と呼んでいる。
sen.e: This sense remains as a fundamental underpinning of Shinto to this day, and Yakumo KOIZUMI maintains that this is "the sensibility of Shinto".
This sense remains as a fundamental underpinning of Shinto to this day, and Yakumo KOIZUMI maintains that this is "the sensibility of Shinto".
This sense remains as a fundamental underpinning of Shinto to this day, and Yakumo KOIZUMI maintains that this is 'the sensibility of Shinto'.

sen.j: 自然は人々に恩恵をもたらすとともに、時には人に危害を及ぼす。
sen.e: Nature bestows benefits onto humankind, and from time to time also presents hazards to humankind.
Nature bestows benefits onto humankind, and from time to time also presents hazards to humankind.
Nature bestows benefits onto humankind, and from time to time also presents hazards to humankind.

sen.j: 古代人はこれを神々しい「何か」の怒り（祟り）と考え、怒りを鎮め、恵みを与えてくれるよう願い、それを崇敬するようになった。
sen.e: Upon being instilled with a sense of awe, as in "that's something else", people in ancient Japan began to venerate of natural entities and phenomona, seeking to placate the anger when they thought that the awe inspiring entity or phenomenon was angry (and would impart misfortune), or to seek blessings.

Upon being instilled with a sense of awe, as in "that's something else", people in ancient Japan began to venerate of natural entities and phenomona, seeking to placate the anger when they thought that the awe inspiring entity or phenomenon was angry (and would impart misfortune), or to seek blessings.

Upon being instilled with a sense that these were anger (curse) of 'something' awe-inspiring, people in ancient Japan began to venerate of natural entities and phenomona, seeking to placate the anger when they thought that the awe inspiring entity or phenomenon was angry (and would impart misfortune), or to seek blessings.
sen.cmt: H30 に合わせて書き直しました。

sen.j: これが後に「カミ（神）」と呼ばれるようになる。
sen.e: These natural entities and phenomona later came to be called "kami".
These natural entities and phenomona later came to be called "kami".
These natural entities and phenomona later came to be called 'kami'.

tit.j: 思考・災いといった抽象的なものを神格化した観念神
tit.e: Kami that have come into existence as the result of the deification of an abstraction such as a concept or an evil.
tit.cmt: a little long for a section title
tit.e: Kami that have come into existence as the result of the deification of an abstraction such as a concept or an evil.
Kami that have come into existence as the result of the deification of an abstraction such as a concept or an evil.

tit.j: 古代の指導者・有力者の神格化
tit.e: Kami that have come into existence by the deification of ancient leaders or influential personages.
Kami that have come into existence by the deification of ancient leaders or influential personages.
Kami that have come into existence by the deification of ancient leaders or influential personages.

sen.j: 3.については、日本において天皇のことを戦前は現人神と呼び、神道上の概念としてだけでなく、政治上においても神とされていたことが挙げられる。
sen.e: With respect to the third category, prior to WWII, the Emperor was said to be a "living god", and this held true not only within the confines of Shinto thought, but in the realm of politics as well, where the Emperor was also considered to be a kami.
sen.cmt: "3"? This was not necessarily the case before Meiji, I presume. Perhaps the time frame requires a little more definition.
sen.e: With respect to the third category, prior to WWII, the Emperor was said to be a "living god", and this held true not only within the confines of Shinto thought, but in the realm of politics as well, where the Emperor was also considered to be a kami.

With respect to the third category, the Emperor was said to be a "living god" prior to WWII, and this held true not only within the confines of Shinto thought, but in the realm of politics as well, where the Emperor was also considered to be a kami.
sen.cmt: prior to WWII の場所を移動

sen.j: 現在では、昭和天皇によるいわゆる人間宣言により政治との関わり、国民との関係は変わった。
sen.e: At present, as a result of the proclamation by Emperor Showa after WWII that he was a human being and not a god, the role of the Emperor in the political realm, and the relationship of the Emperor to the people has changed.

At present, as a result of the proclamation by Emperor Showa after WWII that he was a human being and not a god, the role of the Emperor in the political realm, and the relationship of the Emperor to the people has changed.

At present, as a result of the proclamation by Emperor Showa after WWII that he was a human being and not a god, the role of the Emperor in the political realm, and the relationship of the Emperor to the people has changed.

sen.j: だが、神道においては天照大御神の血を引くとされる天皇の存在は現在も大きな位置を占め、信仰活動の頂点として位置付けられている。
sen.e: However, within the institutional confines of the Shinto religion, the existence of the Emperor as bloodline descendent of the sun goddess, Amaterasu, still occupies an important position, and the Emperor is positioned at the summit of the religious beliefs and practices.

However, within the institutional confines of the Shinto religion, the existence of the Emperor as bloodline descendent of the sun goddess, Amaterasu, still occupies an important position, and the Emperor is positioned at the summit of the religious beliefs and practices.

However, within the institutional confines of the Shinto religion, the existence of the Emperor as bloodline descendent of the sun goddess, Amaterasu Omikami, still occupies an important position, and the Emperor is positioned at the summit of the religious beliefs and practices.
sen.cmt: 天照大御神のOmikami 追記

sen.j: また、その時代の有力者を死後に神として祭る例（豊臣秀吉＝豊国大明神、徳川家康東照大権現ど）や、権力闘争に敗れまた逆賊として処刑された者を、後世において「怒りを鎮める」という意味で神として祭る例（菅原道真、平将門など）もこの分類に含まれる。
sen.e: In addition, there are examples of individuals who having been influential in their eras have come to be venerated as kami after their deaths (e.g. Hideyoshi Toyotomi as the Toyokuni Daimyojin, and Ieyasu Tokugawa as Toshou Daigongen); examples of individuals who, after having lost some sort of struggle for power, were unjustly punished as traitors and have come to be venerated as kami so as to placate their anger (e.g., Sugawara no Michizane, Taira no Masamune), are also included in this category.

In addition, there are examples of individuals who having been influential in their eras have come to be venerated as kami after their deaths (e.g. Hideyoshi Toyotomi as the Toyokuni Daimyojin, and Ieyasu Tokugawa as Toshou Daigongen); examples of individuals who, after having lost some sort of struggle for power, were unjustly punished as traitors and have come to be venerated as kami so as to placate their anger (e.g., Sugawara no Michizane, Taira no Masamune), are also included in this category.

In addition, there are examples of individuals who having been influential in their eras have come to be venerated as kami after their deaths (e.g. Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI as the Toyokuni Daimyojin, and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA as Tosho Daigongen); examples of individuals who, after losing some sort of struggle for power or being punished as traitors, have come to be venerated as kami so as to placate their anger (e.g., SUGAWARA no Michizane, TAIRA no Masamune), are also included in this category.
sen.cmt: 名字をすべて大文字に変更Toshou→Toshoexamples の前のスペース短縮「権力闘争に敗れまた逆賊として処刑された者」の解釈が違うと思い訂正しました。

sen.j: さまざまな部族が個々に固有の神を信仰していた。
sen.e: Each of the various tribes worshiped its individual unique kami.
sen.cmt: I haven't heard Japanese society described as being tribal before, but the clans and Ujigami are topics that appear frequently.
sen.e: Each of the various tribes worshiped its individual unique kami.
Each of the various tribes worshiped its individual unique kami.

sen.j: それらの部族が交流するにしたがって各部族の神が習合し、それによって変容するようになった。
sen.e: Interaction among the tribes brought about the fusion of each of the tribal kami, whereby the Kami were metamorphosized.
Interaction among the tribes brought about the fusion of each of the tribal kami, whereby the Kami were metamorphosized.
Interaction among the tribes brought about the fusion of each of the tribal kami, whereby the Kami were metamorphosized.

sen.j: さらに、北方系のシャーマニズムなども影響を与えた。
sen.e: Shamanism from the north also exerted an influence.
Shamanism from the north also exerted an influence.
Shamanism from the north also exerted an influence.

sen.j: これを「神神習合」と呼ぶ学者もいる。
sen.e: There are scholars who refer to these phenomona as "kamigami shugo" (fusion of the gods).
There are scholars who refer to these phenomona as "kamigami shugo" (fusion of the gods).
There are scholars who refer to these phenomona as 'kamigami shugo' (fusion of the gods).

sen.j: この神神習合が、後に仏教をはじめとする他宗教の神々を受け入れる素地となった。
sen.e: They maintain that this fusion of the gods phenomona laid the foundation for the later introduction of Kami from other religions, starting with Buddhism.
They maintain that this fusion of the gods phenomona laid the foundation for the later introduction of Kami from other religions, starting with Buddhism.
They maintain that this fusion of the gods phenomona laid the foundation for the later introduction of Kami from other religions, starting with Buddhism.

sen.j: 4.は平田篤胤が禁書であったキリスト教関係の書の影響を受け、天御中主神（アメノミナカヌシノカミ）を万物の創造主として位置づけたものである。
sen.e: Hirata Atsutane, who had been influenced by banned books related to Christianity, is the individual who assigned the position of creator of all things to Ameminakanushi no kami.
sen.cmt: where do these numbers come from and why are they not integrated into the text elsewhere?
sen.e: Hirata Atsutane, who had been influenced by banned books related to Christianity, is the individual who assigned the position of creator of all things to Ameminakanushi no kami.
Number 4 is Kami that Atsutane HIRATA, who had been influenced by banned books related to Christianity, assigned the position of creator of all things to Amenominakanushi no kami.
sen.cmt: 姓名の表記変更天御中主神→の (no)追記No. 4 を加えて書き換えました。

sen.j: 尊王攘夷思想の基盤を形成し、近代の教派神道各派にも強い影響を与えている。
sen.e: His thought formed the foundation of the anti-foreigner ideology of the royalist faction, as exemplified by the slogan 'Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians' ('sonnou joi'), which exerted a strong influence on each of the sects of modern Sect Shinto.

His thought formed the foundation of the anti-foreigner ideology of the royalist faction, as exemplified by the slogan 'Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians' ('sonnou joi'), which exerted a strong influence on each of the sects of modern Sect Shinto.

His thought formed the foundation of the anti-foreigner ideology of the royalist faction, as exemplified by the slogan 'Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians' ('sonno joi'), which exerted a strong influence on each of the sects of modern Sect Shinto.
sen.cmt: sonnou→sonno詳しく説明されていますが、このままで良いかご確認願います。

sen.j: 国家神道の基盤ともなったが、神道事務局祭神論争（1880～1881年）での出雲派の敗退により表舞台からは消えて潜勢力となった。
sen.e: This later became the basis of State Shinto (Kokka Shinto); however, after the Izumo faction lost the so-called pantheon dispute (saijin ronso, 1880-1881) within the Shinto Jimukyoku (Bureau of Shinto Affairs), the Atsutane faction fell from prominence and receded into the background, becoming a latent force.

This later became the basis of State Shinto (Kokka Shinto); however, after the Izumo faction lost the so-called pantheon dispute (saijin ronso, 1880-1881) within the Shinto Jimukyoku (Bureau of Shinto Affairs), the Atsutane faction fell from prominence and receded into the background, becoming a latent force.

This later became the basis of State Shinto (Kokka Shinto); however, after the Izumo faction lost the so-called pantheon dispute (saijin ronso, 1880-1881) within the Shinto Jimukyoku (Bureau of Shinto Affairs), this theory fell from prominence and receded into the background, becoming a latent force.
sen.cmt: 出雲派の中心人物は千家尊家で、Atsutane faction というのはないと思います。this theory としました。

sen.j: 天御中主神・高皇産霊神・神皇産霊神は造化三神とされた。
sen.e: Amenominakanushi no kami (God Ruling the Center of Heaven), Takamimusubi-no-kami, and Kamimusubi-no-kami became the three creator deities.
Amenominakanushi no kami (God Ruling the Center of Heaven), Takamimusubi-no-kami, and Kamimusubi-no-kami became the three creator deities.
Amenominakanushi no kami (God Ruling the Center of Heaven), Takamimusubi no kami, and Kamimusubi no kami became the three creator deities.
sen.cmt: コメントにも書かれていますが、ハイフンはすべて削除しました。

sen.j: 造化三神は、多くの復古神道において現在でも究極神とされている。
sen.e: The three creator deities are treated as the supreme kami in many types of restoration Shinto as well as current types of Shinto.
The three creator deities are treated as the supreme kami in many types of restoration Shinto as well as current types of Shinto.
The three creator deities are treated as the supreme kami in many types of restoration Shinto even today.
sen.cmt: as well as current types of Shinto→even today

sen.j: なかでも天御中主神（アメノミナカヌシノカミ）は最高位に位置づけられている。
sen.e: Among these three creator deities, Amenominakanushi no kami is assigned the highest position.
Among these three creator deities, Amenominakanushi no kami is assigned the highest position.
Among these three creator deities, Amenominakanushi no kami is assigned the highest position.

tit.j: 万物の創造主・主宰者としての全能の天皇
tit.e: All-powerful Emperors as the creators and rulers of all things
All-powerful Emperors as the creators and rulers of all things
All-powerful Emperors as the creators and rulers of all things

sen.j: 5.は明治の初期に祭政一致の国家体制を企図した神祇事務局の亀井茲監らが「天皇」と「天」とが同体しているという神儒合一的な観念によって全能の存在としたもの。
sen.e: With the unification of the state and religion in the early days of the Meiji Era, Koremi KAMEI and other s at the Jingi Jimukyoku (Shinto Worship Bureau) promulgated a theory unifying Shinto and Confucianism maintaining that the Emperor was consubstantial with heaven, and therefore omnipotent.

With the unification of the state and religion in the early days of the Meiji Era, Koremi KAMEI and other s at the Jingi Jimukyoku (Shinto Worship Bureau) promulgated a theory unifying Shinto and Confucianism maintaining that the Emperor was consubstantial with heaven, and therefore omnipotent.

As for the number 5, with the unification of the state and religion in the early days of the Meiji period, Koremi KAMEI and others at the Jingi Jimukyoku (Shinto Worship Bureau) promulgated a theory unifying Shinto and Confucianism maintaining that 'the Emperor' was consubstantial with 'heaven', and therefore omnipotent.
sen.cmt: Era→periodother s→others「 」部分に ' ' 文頭に As for number 5, 追記

sen.j: 「天皇ハ万物ノ主宰ニシテ、剖判（ほうはん・「宇宙創造時」の意）以来天統間断無ク天地ト与（とも）ニ化育ヲ同シ玉ヒ……」（『勤斎公奉務要書残編』）などとされる。
sen.e: "The Emperor is the ruler of all things, and has ruled the earth and the heavens without break since the creation of the universe…." (excerpted from a book on conducting public religious services)
"The Emperor is the ruler of all things, and has ruled the earth and the heavens without break since the creation of the universe…." (excerpted from a book on conducting public religious services)
The Emperor is the ruler of all things, and has ruled the earth and the heavens without break since the creation of the universe….' (excerpted from a book on conducting public religious services)

sen.j: 石原莞爾は『最終戦争論・戦争史大論』（原型は1929年7月の中国の長春での「講話要領」）のなかで、下記のように述べている。
sen.e: According to Kanji ISHIWARA (originally delivered as part of the "Lectures on the Essentials" in China at Changchun,
According to Kanji ISHIWARA (originally delivered as part of the "Lectures on the Essentials" in China at Changchun,

In "Saishu senso ron/Senso-shi dairon" written by Kanji ISHIWARA (originally delivered as part of the 'Kowa yoko' (the Outlines of Pacification) in China at Changchun in July 1929), the following descriptions are found.
sen.cmt: 『』の中が抜け落ちています。ウェブから持ってきて原文に入れ訳出しましたが、「定訳不明」です。1929年7月、追記講和要綱の訳、変更しましたが、「定訳不明」です。B69をこのセルに移動し、それに伴って訳文も変更しました。

sen.j: 人類が心から現人神（あらひとがみ）の信仰に悟入したところに、王道文明は初めてその真価を発揮する。
sen.e: "When humankind first awakened to belief in an Arahitogami (a kami who appears in this world in human form), the true value of civilization based on the rule of virtue (the way of kings) shown forth for the first time.
sen.cmt: A rather literary passage, and difficult to separate Shinto and Confucian elements.
sen.e: "When humankind first awakened to belief in an Arahitogami (a kami who appears in this world in human form), the true value of civilization based on the rule of virtue (the way of kings) shown forth for the first time.

When humankind first awakened to belief in an Arahitogami (a kami who appears in this world in human form), the true value of civilization based on the rule of virtue (the way of kings) is shown forth for the first time.

sen.j: 最終戦争即ち王道・覇道の決勝戦は結局、天皇を信仰するものと然らざるものの決勝戦であり、具体的には天皇が世界の天皇とならせられるか、西洋の大統領が世界の指導者となるかを決定するところの、人類歴史の中で空前絶後の大事件である。
sen.e: The final war, that is, the war between the way of rule by virtue and the way of rule by military might is ultimately a war to decide whether the believers in the Emperor or the militarists shall prevail; more specifically, it is a war to decide whether the president of the Western world is to be the leader of the world, or whether the Emperor is to be the Emperor of the world, making it an unprecedented event in the history of humankind.

The final war, that is, the war between the way of rule by virtue and the way of rule by military might is ultimately a war to decide whether the believers in the Emperor or the militarists shall prevail; more specifically, it is a war to decide whether the president of the Western world is to be the leader of the world, or whether the Emperor is to be the Emperor of the world, making it an unprecedented event in the history of humankind.

The final war, that is, the war between the way of rule by virtue and the way of rule by military might is ultimately a war to decide whether the believers or the non-believers in the Emperor shall prevail; more specifically, it is a war to decide whether the Emperor is to be the Emperor of the world or whether the president of the Western world is to be the leader of the world, making it an unprecedented event in the history of humankind.
sen.cmt: is の前のスペース短縮believers in the Emperor or the militarists→believers or non-believers in the Emperor天皇と大統領のどちらが指導者になるかの「天皇」と「大統領」の順序が逆になっているので原文どおりに訂正しました。

sen.e: "Chi", "mi", "hi" (spirits) are frequently appended to the Shinmyo of nature kami, as in the cases of Shinmyo for spirits (Kagutsuchi, Ooyamatumi, etc, in which the syllable "tsu" means the same as the syllable "no").

sen.j: 「ムス」（産）「ムツ」（親）「ムチ」（祖）は何かを産み出した祖神を表し「キ」「ヲ」（男）「シ」「コ」（子）「ヒコ」（彦・比古・毘古）は男神、「メ」（女）「ヒメ」（媛・姫・比売・毘売）は女神につけられるものである。
sen.e: The syllables "musu" (birth), "mutsu" (parent) and "muchi" (ancestor) designate ancestor kami that have given birth to something; the syllables "ki", "nu" (male), "shi", "ko" (child), and "hiko" indicate male kami, while "me" (female), "hime" indicate female kami.

sen.j: 特に「メ」のつく神は、巫女を神格化した神であるとされることが多い。

sen.j: 「コ」は国造（ミヤツコ）小野妹子など、元は男性を表したが、藤原氏が女性名として独占し、近世までは皇后など一部の身分の高い女性しか名乗れなかった事から、現代では女性名として定着した。
sen.e: The suffix "ko" was originally used to indicate a male, as in the case of kuninomiyatsuko ONO no Imoko; however, as the Fujiwara clan had monopolized all the names for females, because it only a portion of females of high position, such as the Empress, were able to have names up until the modern era, "ko" has become a popular suffic for female names at present.

The suffix 'ko' was originally used to indicate a male, as in the case of kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor) ONO no Imoko; however, as the Fujiwara clan had monopolized all the names for females, because it only a portion of females of high position, such as the Empress, were able to have the names with 'ko' up until the modern era, 'ko' has become a popular suffix for female names at present.

sen.j: 16世紀にキリスト教が日本に入ってきた時、キリスト教で信仰の対象となるものは「デウス」「天主」などと呼ばれ、神道の神とは（仏教の仏とも）別のものとされた。
sen.e: When Christianity arrived in Japan in the 16th century, the object of worship venerated by the Christians, "Deus", was referred to as the "Lord of Heaven" and the like, and was treated as a separate deity from the deities of both Shinto and Buddhism.

The word pronounced "kami" in Japanese has numerous meanings, including "top", "chief", "director", "Emperor", "lord", "head", count" and the like, and originally meant a person of high stature in society.
